sentences.en: a chubby five-year-old with a cheeky grin
sentences.cn: 一个胖嘟嘟、咧着嘴调皮地笑着的五岁孩子

sentences.en: Do you get how damned cheeky that was?
Don't put out your tongue at me, you cheeky girl!
sentences.cn: 不要向我伸舌头, 你这个没规矩的丫头!

sentences.en: He was being cheeky, so I gave him a smack on the jaw.
sentences.cn: 他太无礼了, 所以我一拳打在他的下巴上. 响吻

sentences.en: Her cheeky remarks really get up my nose!
sentences.cn: 她那些不要脸的话真惹我生气!

sentences.en: His cheeky chappy image is reinforced by the spiky hair and the wide grin.
sentences.cn: 他那直立的头发和咧着嘴的笑容使他更像个厚脸皮的家伙。

sentences.en: I don't like his cheeky manner.
sentences.cn: 我不喜欢他不要脸的态度.

sentences.en: I found his cheeky self - confidence unbearable.
sentences.cn: 我感到他那种目中无人的狂妄简直令人难以忍受.

sentences.en: I want none of your cheek ! ie Stop being cheeky!
Laura glanced at Grace, expecting a cheeky riposte.
sentences.cn: 劳拉匆匆瞥了格雷斯一眼，想着他会厚着脸皮巧妙地反驳一下。

sentences.en: Less of your lip ! ie Don't be so cheeky!
Martin gave her a cheeky grin.
sentences.cn: 马丁冲着她调皮地笑了笑。

sentences.en: Now don’t be cheeky to your elders, young woman.
That was awfully cheeky of you.
The boy was cheeky and casual.
sentences.cn: 那个小男孩有点放肆，随随便便的。

words.tran_cn: 无礼地向…讲话，对…大胆无礼

trans.tran_cn: 无礼的，不要脸的，厚颜无耻的
trans.tran_en: rude or disrespectful, sometimes in a way that is amusing
